definition: to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: The hotel offers its guests a wide variety of amusements.
sentences.chinese: 这个旅馆为住客提供了各种各样的娱乐活动。

sentences.english: Are you the owner, lessee, tenant or contractor?
sentences.chinese: 阁下是否物主，承租人，住客或承辨人？

sentences.english: Open the guestroom door when the room attendant canconfirm the guest identity.
sentences.chinese: 楼层服务员能确定客人是此房住客，可开门。

sentences.english: Residents of participating estates can enjoy a first-time trial service to get personal experience of the benefits of massage.
sentences.chinese: 屋苑住客特享初次试做服务，亲身体验服务个中好处。

sentences.english: The Giverny Clubhouse is a very small but public building.
sentences.chinese: 溱乔住客会所是一座小型的公共建筑。

sentences.english: Luckily, one of the hostel’s guests understood.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是，青年旅社的一个住客明白。

sentences.english: The guest's extension number is confidential.
sentences.chinese: 住客的分机号码是保密的。

sentences.english: Residents can enjoy free rides on the card.
sentences.chinese: 酒店住客凭房卡可免费乘车。

definition: to check in (at a hotel etc)
